messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] the game Countdown
messages.msgSnippet: Oh, that one is a lot of fun.  My 4yo DS love to play that game with us.  He also love Toy Story Yahtzee Jr., Trouble, Jenga, Connect Four, Parcheesi, and
messages.messageBody:
Oh, that one is a lot of fun. My 4yo DS love to play that game with
us. He also love Toy Story Yahtzee Jr., Trouble, Jenga, Connect Four,
Parcheesi, and Chutes and Ladders.

Countdown I've seen at Toys R Us....I'll have to give it a better look
and maybe pick it up next time we're there. :)
-Tracy-

On Feb 24, 2004, at 9:05 PM, Elizabeth Roberts wrote:

> I think this is going to become a favorite! I also bought the "Guess
> Who?" game that Sarah's been asking for for awhile, although we
> haven't put it together yet.

messages.subject: the game Countdown
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks, everyone for the recommendations for this game! It came in today! Sarah, Logan, and I played for an hour tonight and had a great time! Logan started to
messages.messageBody:
Thanks, everyone for the recommendations for this game! It came in today! Sarah, Logan, and I played for an hour tonight and had a great time! Logan started to recognize some numbers as we played. Sarah did well, and even beat me a couple times and was using all four modes of operation.

I think this is going to become a favorite! I also bought the "Guess Who?" game that Sarah's been asking for for awhile, although we haven't put it together yet.

Elizabeth
